Key Match Events: The benches cleared after Royals third baseman Maikel Garcia had a hard slide into second base and took an incidental forearm from Anthony Volpe while he was making the tag to finish off a double play.
Gerrit Cole walked toward Garcia before catcher Austin Wells intercepted him and held him back.
Aaron Judge and Juan Soto were among the Yankees players stepping in between Volpe and Garcia.
Pre-Game Insights: Jazz Chisholm put himself in the crosshairs of the ALDS by saying the Royals got “lucky” in their Game 2 win and insisting the Yankees would still win the series.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone joked after the game that the altercation couldn’t compare to Yankees-Royals games of yesteryear.
Manager Aaron Boone said he did not know what everyone was mad about, but indicated it paled in comparison to the Yankees-Royals rivalry of old.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees won the series-clinching Game 4 win over the Royals with a 3-1 score.
The stakes are high, everyone’s playing hard, everyone’s trying to win. They’re playing for their season.
Others: Maikel Garcia had retweeted a video of Carlos Rodon being pumped up after striking out the side in the first inning and commented, “Don’t celebrate too early.”
He also posted, “We don’t fear nobody.”
